text: Maren Morris (born April 10, 1990) is an American singer. Her album, Hero, reached number five on the Billboard 200 chart and number one on the Top Country Albums chart, in the United States. The album is her fourth studio album. Morris was born in Arlington, Texas. ==Discography== * Hero (2016) * Girl (2019) ===Singles=== *"Chasing After You" (with Ryan Hurd) (2021) ;Music charts Title Year Highest chart positions Certifications Sales Album US US Country Songs US Country Airplay US Pop CAN CAN Country IRE Peak positions on Irish Singles Chart: * "The Middle": * "Seeing Blind": * "The Bones": NZ SCO Peak chart positions in Scotland: * For "My Church": * For "The Middle": "My Church" 2016 50 5 9 — 64 3 — — 43 * RIAA: 2× Platinum * MC: 2x Platinum * US: 974,000 Hero "80s Mercedes" 74 11 12 — — 17 — — — * RIAA: Platinum * MC: Platinum * US: 236,000 "I Could Use a Love Song" 2017 56 7 1 — — 14 — — — * RIAA: Platinum * MC: Platinum * US: 206,000 "The Middle" (with Zedd and Grey) 2018 5 — — 1 6 — 7 8 8 * * MC: 4× Platinum * RMNZ: Platinum * ARIA: 5× Platinum *US: 734,000 "Rich" 62 8 4 — — 2 — — — * RIAA: Platinum * MC: Gold *US: 159,000 Hero "Seeing Blind" (with Niall Horan) — — — — — — 68 — — Flicker "Girl" 2019 44 8 1 — 84 5 — — — * RIAA: Platinum * MC: Platinum *US: 155,000 Girl "The Bones" 12 1 1 13 45 1 63 — — *ARIA: Gold * RIAA: 3x Platinum * MC: Platinum *US: 195,000 "To Hell & Back" 2020 — 35 32 — — 48 — — — "Line by Line" (with JP Saxe) 2021 — — — — 96 — — — — Dangerous Levels of Introspection "Chasing After You" 78 16 28 — 84 34 — — — "Bigger Man" — — — — — — — — — In Defense of My Own Happiness "—" denotes releases that did not chart. == Notes == ==References== Category:American country singers Category:Singers from Texas Category:1990 births
